keywords.cdata: Crises, equipment, greenhouse gas, greenhouse gas emissions, habitats, Indigenous Peoples, laboratories, marketing, NGOs, ozone, Ph, Resettlement, Safety, transport

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Reduction of Ozone Project (Montreal Protocol) for Argentina is to: (a) support Argentina's program to phase out ozone depleting substances (ODS) consumption through the provision of technical and technological assistance; and (b) strengthen the institutional framework in Argentina to better identify, prepare, evaluate, and administrate subprojects. This restructuring will reallocate funds in the amount of USD 290,000 from category one (sub grants; investments) to category two (goods and consultants' services under part B of the project; consultancies and project management). The reallocation of grant proceeds is needed to finance the increase in consultancy and project management costs associated with the last extension of this umbrella project's closing date from November 30, 2010 until December 30, 2014.
